original: aa pa r'a dzi t'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: aa pa r'a dzi t'a s'a dha nam /

original: gzhan gyis mi thub ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Achievement of Aparajita

original: gzhan gyis mi thub ma ni sku mdog ser mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub ma ni sku mdog ser mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma ste /
translated: Aparajita is yellow, with one face and two arms.

original: rin po che sna tshogs kyis nye bar mdzes par gyur pa'i tshogs bdag legs par mnan pa phyag g-yas pa ni thal mo gdengs pa'i stangs mdzad pa /üîΩphyag g-yon pa ni zhags pa bsnams @17a * //
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs kyis nye bar mdzes par gyur pa'i tshogs bdag legs par mnan pa phyag g-yas pa ni thal mo gdengs pa'i stangs mdzad pa / phyag g-yon pa ni zhags pa bsnams @17a * //
translated: She stands on Ganesha, who is adorned with various jewels. With her right hand she makes the gesture of the open palm.

original: pa'i sdigs mdzub thugs ka na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i sdigs mdzub thugs ka na gnas pa'o //
translated: In her left hand she holds a noose and a threatening forefinger at her heart.

original: gdug pa'i zhal mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
analyzed: gdug pa'i zhal mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
translated: She has a wrathful face with bared fangs.

original: bdud rnams ma lus pa nges par rlag par mdzad pa /
analyzed: bdud rnams ma lus pa nges par rlag par mdzad pa /
translated: She is the one who definitely destroys all demons.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa dang drag cing ma bgrungs pa'i lha 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la cher mtho ba'i gdugs btag pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa dang drag cing ma bgrungs pa'i lha 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la cher mtho ba'i gdugs btag pa'o //
translated: She is the one who raises a parasol of great loftiness for Brahma and so forth, and for the wrathful and evil gods and their retinues.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub ma'i sgrub thabs aa bha ya las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub ma'i sgrub thabs aa bha ya las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The Sadhana of Aparajita was translated by Bhiksu Shila-shri-jnanamitra.
